title: Crocus Technology Acquired by Allegro MicroSystems to Accelerate Innovation in TMR Sensing Technology - PR Newswire
summary: Allegro MicroSystems, a leader in power and sensing semiconductor technology, has acquired Crocus Technology, a leader in advanced Tunnel Magnetoresistance (TMR) sensor technology, for $420 million in cash. This acquisition will accelerate Allegro's growth in the automotive and industrial markets, and Crocus's best-in-class TMR technology will complement Allegro's existing product offerings.  TMR is the fastest-growing segment of the magnetic sensing market, which is expected to reach $5 billion by 2030. The acquisition will enable Allegro to offer a broader range of TMR products to its customers, and Crocus's expertise will help Allegro to further strengthen its leadership in magnetic sensors.  The combined company will be well-positioned to capitalize on the growing demand for TMR technology in the automotive and industrial markets.

title: Global Net-Zero Energy Buildings (NZEBs) Strategic Research Report 2023-2030: Energy Efficient Buildings in the ... - Yahoo Finance
summary: The global market for Net-Zero Energy Buildings (NZEBs) is projected to reach $114.5 billion by 2030, growing at a CAGR of 22%. NZEBs are buildings that produce as much energy as they consume, typically through the use of renewable energy sources and energy-efficient building materials and systems. The growth of the NZEB market is being driven by government regulations, corporate sustainability goals, and consumer demand for more sustainable buildings.
green_innovation: TRUE. NZEBs are a green innovation because they reduce negative environmental externalities by reducing energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions.
business_innovation: TRUE. NZEBs are a business innovation because they represent a new and improved way of designing and constructing buildings that is significantly different from previous methods.
green_product: TRUE. NZEBs are a green product because they are designed to reduce environmental impact throughout their life cycle, from the materials used in their construction to the energy they consume during operation.
green_process: TRUE. The design and construction of NZEBs involves green processes, such as the use of sustainable materials, energy-efficient construction techniques, and renewable energy systems.

greenwashing: FALSE. NZEBs are not an example of greenwashing because they genuinely reduce environmental impact and are not marketed as being more environmentally friendly than they actually are.

title: Asia-Pacific HVAC (Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning) Market 2023-2028 Featuring Key Vendors - Daikin ... - Yahoo Finance
summary: The APAC HVAC market is projected to surge from $102.17 billion in 2022 to $148.59 billion by 2028, with a CAGR of 6.4%. The growth is driven by the increasing demand for HVAC systems in the residential and commercial sectors, as well as the growing awareness of energy efficiency and climate change challenges. Major players in the market are focusing on strategic agreements, acquisitions, and collaborations to capitalize on the growth potential.

title: Borivali WEH Witnesses Jangid Group's CP Meet Triumph, Setting the Stage for a Promising Commercial Tower - PR Newswire
summary: Jangid Group, a real estate developer in Mumbai, has launched a new commercial project on Western Express Highway in Borivali. The project is designed to be sustainable and includes eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. The project is expected to attract businesses and investors due to its strategic location and modern design.
